fields.description:
Need to implement user landing page with views, filters and actions in wireframe.

https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Users+landing+page

comments.body:
What's not working (that I know of);
- filters. Not populating properly from the groups. Don't know how to implement the boolean options.
- The disable and delete options aren't implemented
- no help content
- grid view lacks state indicator at bottom of each cell
need to get data items right. Also implement enable/disable

I pushed to GUI-333
please have a look at the user landing page with tiles. It shows the data that's being fetched and I'm finding it takes about 15 seconds to fetch all that data for the 16 users I have on 5.50 (ui-test-acct-00/admin)
I stacked the groups on the table view. Given the column width, the side-by-side groups would have wrapped soon anyway.

Looking good, a couple of things:

* Links on the landing page for keys, groups, etc should link to the detail page for the *user*, anchored to the section for the thing you clicked on. So for example, if you click the group, it should take you to the user's detail page, anchored to the area of the page where it shows what groups the user is in. -done
* access key count and PW icon should be links that anchor to the user's detail page this same way. -done
* access key count should say "<x> active" please. I need to add that to the wireframe but confluence is down ATM. Sorry! -done
* groups listed on the tiles are not aligned with the two-letter label. They should be aligned more like the access key count and password check are, please. -done
* page needs title please.
* add user button should say Create User instead - done

check it out! I think it is done pretty well! I didn't do the status filter because I'd have to re-do how status is handled. Not impossible, but figured that might get prioritized lower than some other things.

Ayiee! The links on the landing pages don't necessarily link to the right thing on the detail page now (passwords and keys) that we moved to tabs! Sorry!

Also, should have enable/disable available on user detail pages actions too please.

ok. If the correct tab is shown, the links work, but the problem is getting the right tab to show. Looking at ways to do that since foundation doesn't seem to support pre-selection of a tab. Might have to do it with angular.

[~dkavanagh], I noticed this works correctly on links from the scaling groups landing page, like when you click on the instance count on the landing page it takes you to the instances tab. Maybe there's some enlightening code there you can use?
Those tabs are implemented as discrete page, which is why that works.
aw, dang...nevermind then, I thought it might be helpful...
